content:
Diagnosis:	Choroid Plexus Tumor with increasing size and progressive neurological symptoms.

Tumor Characteristics:	Primary lesion measuring 4.2cm in the left lateral ventricle with associated obstructive hydrocephalus and midline shift.
	Histopathology confirmed atypical choroid plexus papilloma (WHO Grade II) with high mitotic activity.
	MRI July 2023 showed tumor size increase to 5.1cm with evidence of brainstem compression.

Treatment History:	Surgical resection (subtotal) March 2023, followed by adjuvant fractionated radiotherapy April-May 2023 (total dose 54Gy/30 fractions).
	Initiated temozolomide 75mg/m2 daily June 2023. Reduced dose August 2023 due to grade 3 thrombocytopenia.
	September 2023 MRI indicated stable disease.
	December 2023 imaging revealed new growth (6.2cm) and increased peritumoral edema.
	Commenced bevacizumab January 2024 (10mg/kg biweekly).

Current Consultation:	[redacted name] presents with worsening headache, nausea, and reduced mobility.

Symptoms:
	Progressive gait instability, requires wheelchair for mobility.
	Persistent headache poorly controlled with analgesics.
	Severe fatigue impacting daily activities.

Examination:
	Performance Status ECOG 3.
	Papilledema on fundoscopy, no focal motor deficits.

Investigations:	MRI 15/02/2024: Significant tumor progression to 6.9cm with enhanced peritumoral edema and worsening midline shift.
	CSF cytology negative for malignant cells.

Current Medications:	Bevacizumab, dexamethasone 8mg daily, ondansetron, and omeprazole.

Plan:
	Increase dexamethasone to 12mg daily for symptomatic control of edema.
	Urgent referral to neurosurgery for reconsideration of resection options.
	Schedule stereotactic radiosurgery planning.
	Discuss clinical trial enrollment at the next neuro-oncology MDT.
	Arrange repeat MRI in four weeks.
	Review in clinic with imaging results.
